div.p: This Implementation Guide publishes IHE Common CodingSystem and ValueSet Resources. It present includes the IHE managed CodeSystem and ValueSet for FormatCode and the CodeSystem for AgeRange.

FormatCode is a metadata element for identifying the technical format that a document follows. This is related to mimeType, but is more specific to the content requirements than the encoding requirement. Therefore a document following a FormatCode may have many mimeType encodings. The FormatCode is also related to the document type (e.g. LOINC document type), but is more specific to the requirements (constraints) of the content.
AgeRange is a common coding system for specifying age ranges in content profiles. It is presently used by the ADX profiles but can be used for other purposes.
The main sections of this IG are:

ul.li: FormatCode Background - provides more detail on what a FormatCode is and how they are maintained
The IHE defined Codes - the definition of the codes defined by IHE for use in FormatCode
The IHE defined ValueSet - the valueset of codes for FormatCode use.

li.a: The IHE defined codes for age ranges.
